title: 8 new problems with latest update
content:
Not sure where to put this; too many issues at the same time.

Initial post: https://forums.debian.net/viewtopic.php?p=792869#p792869

cat history.log-* history.log | grep -i firefox -B2 Start-Date: 2024-02-11 19:50:43 Commandline: /usr/bin/unattended-upgrade Upgrade: thunderbird-l10n-en-gb:amd64 (1:102.13.1-1~deb11u1, 1:115.7.0-1~deb11u1), thunderbird:amd64 (1:102.13.1-1~deb11u1, 1:115.7.0-1~deb11u1), thunderbird-l10n-fr:amd64 (1:102.13.1-1~deb11u1, 1:115.7.0-1~deb11u1)

1: - Thunderbird moved the top menu bar to the left, now has unreachable buttons at the bottom due to negative interactions with other menus and window manager => tried many forums, but all changes to ./chrome/userChrome.css are ignored. 2: - the quick filter button was moved from the toolbar to an individual bar, adding one new line above message list, reducing the vertical space for content 3: - new management of borders have negative interactions with window manager (tried both options, with and without decoration, both are ... BAD). making it impossible for window manager to properly resize window magnet to other windows 4: - there are large sensibility zones for decoration management catched by TB that make some buttons unreachable in the left bar, and the window manager gadgets i have below (quick launch and desktop management) 5: - there is a new sensibility zone between the top menu bar and the top decoration of windows that give access to some window manager menu, useless at this place, and it reduced the vertical sensibility zone of the buttons, making the click box smaller, and reducing the effective size of buttons, making them harder to click 6: - the unread message count which used to be a nice light blue is now white in a dark grey box, catching the eye more than necessary, slowing me down, and increasing my brain work to focus on what i need to do. also this value is unconsistent; my inbox is curretly shown with 411 total messages, and 630 unread. If i unfold the folder in left column, it seems i have only 89 unread in inbox, and 2 in one subflder, but, to me, 89+2 is not equal to 630. 7: - the file/edit/view menu bar is now BELOW the actions buttons Get/Write/Reply ... 8: - if I roll up the TB windows in the top decoration, any mouse click in the place where the win used to be remains inefficient. So, TB completely broke E17. A shaded win still occupies the screen as if it's unshaded, and more (about 20 pixels below the bottom decoration). 9: - It's 20y the message list was aligned on the top message, so I always made that box half a message taller than an exact message line height multiple, so that the half line white space was a proof I was at the bottom of the list. Now, the list is aligned bottom, and the top line is shown half. I now have no way to know if i am in middle on bottom of list (plus lift is now auto hide).

i don't have any screenshot from previous version for reference. And half issues are bad interactions with E17 about magnetism, and size of click boxes, and this can't be shown on screenshots; even videos would not help if you can't feel it physically, or never used E17 yourself in the past; you can't know how it used to behave.

All these changes have an intense negative impact on my work speed. They slow me down.

TB had almost not changed in 20y of use, but these changes, at the same time, with so many consequences on window manager ... I can't stand it. 20y of habits lost in one evening. Not something you can change at my age.

I have seen only one improvement (bug fix) in recent TB: "save all" attachements works now fine from the menu under the message, and we no longer need to use Save All from top menus (regression bug between TB 1.2 and 1.5, IIRC).
creator: benoit12

title: Folder appearance and priority
content:
I previously posted here about an issue where Thunderbird would display document icons instead of folders in the Favorite Folders view, and also put these icons at the top of the list, out of alphanumeric order. In the previous thread a fix was suggested...

...but that fix no longer works, and new folders on a brand-new installation of Thunderbird (with no previous profiles on this system) now exhibit the same behavior.

The Favorite Folders view should display folders using folder icons and in alphanumeric order. What steps can I take to ensure Thunderbird does so?

This is on 115.7.0 running on MacOS 14.3.1. Thanks.
creator: info7087

title: Desaparecen los correos de enviados o bandeja de entrada
content:
Buenos días a todos, tengo el siguiente problema, se me ha presentado ya en 6 PCs esta misma incidencia, Tengo la carpeta de enviados que por ejemplo pesa 2GB, y/o la bandeja de entrada 5GB, abres el Thunderbith y ves todos los correos están bien, un día, de repente abres el Thunderbith y ves que la carpeta de enviados o bandeja de entrada está en blanco o hay unos 5 correos no más, vas y abres la carpeta donde tienes tus .mbox y resulta que la carpeta de enviados que tenías en 2GB ahora pesa solo 700KB y/o la carpeta de Bandeja de entrada ahora pesa solo o 900KB... las preguntas:

-Que se hicieron los correos? -Dónde están? -Por que pasa esto? -Como recupero/restauro el contenido?

(La única manera que he podido recuperar algo de correos es corriendo un programa de recuperación de datos en escala de máxima búsqueda/recuperación)
creator: carjul6

title: Thunderbird doesn't retrieve hotmail emails.
content: I'm using Thunderbird for email and it's worked without flaw for maybe a decade. As of a few days ago it's not connecting to the Hotmail server to retrieve emails. Initially it had forgotten and asked for the password and when that was entered, and checked remember password, it connected and downloaded emails. Now it's not even doing that. Could someone please let me know what my Connection security and Authentication method should be set to? Currently it's SSL/TLS and OAuth2. I've tried every possible combination with no success. The sever is pop3.live.com and the port is 995. Thanks for any help.

title: Marking messages as "read" AFTER opening WITHOUT using 'Message Pane'
content: Back in 2015 someone asked about the fact that emails are not marked "as read" once opened but I don't think the answer was ever fully given. They were told: "This option has always been available and I use it. via Menu Bar Tools > Options > Advanced > Reading & Display or via menu icon menu icon > Options > Options > Advanced > Reading & Display select: 'automatically mark messages as read' Select: 'Immediately on display' click on OK When you select/left click an email in the list, it will auto open and display in the Message Pane below the list. If you use double click, it will auto open in a new tab or window depending upon what you selected. In bth instances the message will be immediately marked as read." Here's my problem with that .... I don't use the "Message Pane", I don't like it. I have my incoming messages set at "table view" and they are all just listed down the page by date. I don't want to see what's in the email until I actually open it....but, once I open it and read it when I close out of it the email still stays BOLD in the list....this didn't used to happen, once I read the email the BOLD went away. When I use the "automatically mark message as read immediately on display" then new emails are not in BOLD so I can't tell if they've been read or not. Bottom line, is there a way to have messages marked "read" AFTER they are opened WITHOUT using the message pane??

title: Use my OS browser (Installed Chrome) to authenticate to an email account
content:
Hi everyone!

I'm trying to authenticate to my corporate email, which uses Google Mail, but I'm having some issues due to the security requirements. To authenticate to the email, I need to confirm the authentication with a Passkey, which I use the Bitwarden password manager. When I try to authenticate the email in Thunderbird, it opens a "browser" window where I should provide my email, password, and confirmation through Passkey. As this "browser" doesn't have the Bitwarden extension installed and is impossible to install, I cannot confirm the login.

Is there a way to change a configuration on Thunderbird instead of opening its browser, opening the browser installed in my OS where I have the Bitwarden extension installed, and logging in to confirm the login through Passkey? This behavior is the one used by Mailspring to authenticate an email account.
creator: artur.garcia.costa

title: Exchange Contacts missing addresses and phone numbers in Thunderbird
content:
Hello :) I am using Thunderbird on Fedora 39. I am also using the OWL add-on which I guess is on a trial for the next 30 days.

Anyway; my one and only email account is hosted Exchange (office365) through Rackspace. When I set up Thunderbird to use my email, everything seems to work and work flawlessly with the exception of Contacts.

All of my contacts are listed, but they are all mostly missing their phone numbers and addresses. I have not LOST any data to my knowledge (My mobile devices and three other computers running either Windows 11 or macOS Sonoma still show all of the missing information). My concern is that if this info is missing and I go to put in a new address or phone number in Thunderbird, that I might mistakenly delete information when updating a record when it goes to sync.

Anyone know what is going on?
